predictions.text: At its November 2025 FOMC meeting (statement dated 2025-11-05), the Federal Reserve will leave the target range for the federal funds rate unchanged from its prior level.
predictions.verification_criteria: FOMC statement and implementation note on federalreserve.gov show the target range unchanged versus the range in effect immediately before the meeting.
evidence: August JOLTS showed steady labor demand, reducing urgency to hike. https://www.bls.gov/news.release/archives/jolts_09302025.htm
Fed’s SCB reconsideration signals caution into next CCAR cycle. https://www.federalreserve.gov/newsevents/pressreleases/bcreg20250930a.htm
predictions.rationale: Cooling inflation and mixed growth argue for patience; markets lean toward a hold.

predictions.text: ISM Services PMI (headline) for September 2025 will print between 51.0 and 53.5 in ISM’s release on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Headline Services PMI value in the ISM Report On Business: Services for September 2025.
evidence: Consumer services have remained resilient amid steady labor demand.
ISM Services historical volatility suggests a mid-50s central tendency. https://www.ismworld.org/supply-management-news-and-reports/reports/ism-report-on-business/services/
monitoring_signals: S&P Global US Services PMI (final) for September
High-frequency card spending and mobility indicators
predictions.rationale: Resilient services activity with modest cooling suggests low-50s print.

predictions.text: U.S. Producer Price Index (Final Demand, MoM, SA) for September 2025 will print between 0.1% and 0.4% in the BLS release on 2025-10-09.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS PPI Final Demand month-over-month, seasonally adjusted percentage change for September 2025.
evidence: Energy inputs and freight costs have stabilized, pointing to moderate PPI.
BLS PPI methodology and recent trend. https://www.bls.gov/ppi/
predictions.rationale: Moderate upstream price pressures imply a modest PPI gain.

predictions.text: U.S. Core PCE price index (YoY, SA) for September 2025 will print between 2.6% and 2.9% in the BEA release on 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: BEA release shows year-over-year percent change for PCE excluding food and energy (seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 within the stated range.
evidence: Core inflation trend easing with slower wage growth and shelter lags.
BEA PCE price index reference. https://www.bea.gov/data/personal-consumption-expenditures-price-index
predictions.rationale: Disinflation continues gradually; core PCE remains high-2s YoY.

predictions.text: EIA-reported 4-week average U.S. product supplied of finished motor gasoline will print at or below 8.60 million barrels per day in at least one Weekly Petroleum Status Report released by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report table shows the 4-week moving average for finished motor gasoline product supplied at or below 8.60 mb/d by the deadline.
evidence: Post-summer seasonality typically lowers gasoline demand.
Higher pump prices can suppress discretionary driving. https://www.eia.gov/petroleum/supply/weekly/
monitoring_signals: Mobility data (Apple/Google) and GasBuddy demand estimates
predictions.rationale: Seasonality and elevated prices point to softer gasoline demand.

predictions.text: The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or below 13.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official Cboe VIX closing value at or below 13.00 on any trading day through 2025-11-30.
evidence: Markets have absorbed macro headlines with limited spillover to broad equity volatility.
Mega-cap leadership often compresses implied vol. https://www.cboe.com/tradable_products/vix/
predictions.rationale: Volatility tends to mean-revert lower during risk-on phases.

predictions.text: OpenAI’s Sora app will rank in the top 3 of the U.S. iOS App Store Top Free Apps at least once by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Apple App Store (US) Top Free Apps chart shows the Sora app ranked #1–#3 on any day by the deadline; verification via App Store charts or reputable trackers’ archived snapshots.
evidence: High-profile Sora 2 launch and dedicated app rollout. https://techcrunch.com/2025/09/30/openai-is-launching-the-sora-app-its-own-tiktok-competitor-alongside-the-sora-2-model/
Strong viral potential for generative video content.
monitoring_signals: Download velocity and social media mentions
predictions.rationale: OpenAI’s brand and viral video features should propel rapid adoption.

predictions.text: NVIDIA (NVDA) market capitalization will reach or exceed $5.0 trillion on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Market cap reported by major financial data sources (e.g., Nasdaq, Yahoo Finance) or shares outstanding × closing price equals or exceeds $5.0T on any trading day by the deadline.
evidence: NVDA market cap surpassed $4.5T amid AI infrastructure momentum. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/30/nvidias-market-cap-tops-4point5-trillion-on-ai-infrastructure-deals.html
monitoring_signals: Data center demand and AI capex announcements
predictions.rationale: Sustained AI demand and earnings momentum can lift valuation further.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, the U.S. Treasury’s OFAC will announce a Russia-related sanctions action that adds at least 20 new entries to the SDN List.
predictions.verification_criteria: An OFAC press release and concurrent SDN List update on home.treasury.gov show 20 or more newly designated Russia-related individuals/entities on the same action date.
evidence: EU and UK plan new sanctions rounds; U.S. typically coordinates. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/01/carbon-border-tax-us-china-and-india-lash-out-at-eu-climate-policy.html
U.S. Treasury frequently updates Russia-related sanctions. https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-releases
monitoring_signals: OFAC press advisories and SDN updates
predictions.rationale: Ongoing coordination suggests another sizable U.S. sanctions package.

predictions.text: Freddie Mac’s Primary Mortgage Market Survey (PMMS) 30-year fixed-rate mortgage will print at or above 6.75% in at least one weekly release by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any PMMS weekly report through 2025-10-31 shows the national average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage at ≥ 6.75%.
evidence: Elevated long-term Treasury yields and firm MBS spreads keep mortgage rates high.
PMMS historical behavior tracks 10Y yields and spreads. https://www.freddiemac.com/pmms
predictions.rationale: Rates remain elevated with sticky term premia and macro uncertainty.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. initial jobless claims will print at or above 230,000 in at least one weekly DOL report released by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: The Department of Labor’s Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims Report shows SA initial claims >= 230,000 in any weekly release through the deadline.
evidence: Hiring has slowed from 2024 highs; episodic shocks (strikes, idiosyncratic closures) can lift claims.
DOL UI weekly claims reports. https://www.dol.gov/ui/data
predictions.rationale: Gradual labor cooling and one-off factors likely push claims higher briefly.
